alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 28 at 9:32PM CDT until July 29 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WHITESIDE...SOUTH CENTRAL CARROLL AND EAST CENTRAL CLINTON COUNTIES... At 932 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing tornadoes were located along a line extending from Wacker to Garden Plain, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. These dangerous storms will be near... Morrison, Fenton, Whiteside County Fairgrounds, Unionville and Morrison-Rockwood State Park around 940 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these tornadic storms include Lyndon, Franklin Corners and Hamilton Corners. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
